name: Fried Chicken
steps: Mix Buttermilk, Garlic, Onion, Chili, Oregano, and Cayenne
Add 1/2 teaspoon Salt and 1 teaspoon Pepper into the mixture
Cut each Chicken Breast into 3 (or 4) filets
Each filet should be 1/2" thick or less
Pound each filet with a meat tenderizer on both sides
Marinate all the filets overnight in the Buttermilk Mixture
Mix Flour, Baking Powder, 1 tsp Salt, and 2 tsp Black Pepper
Pull each filet, let drip 'til lightly coated, and cover in dry mix
Place the covered filets on a grate
Crack the Eggs into the marinade and mix until homogenous
Re-dip each covered filet in the marinade and return to grate
Let sit on grate for 30 minutes
Pour Vegetable Oil into your frying pan until it's 1/4" deep
Put pan on low heat (maybe slightly higher?). Aim for 275F
Place the filets in the oil
If the oil is sizzling, it's too hot. You want more of a weak fizzle
Cook for 10-15 minutes on one side, then 10-15 minutes on the other
Aim for a light-golden shade to your breading
Let filets sit on a clean grate for 5-10 minutes then serve
comments: If you sub in Drumsticks, finish the job in the oven at 400F for like 20 minutes.
